content: Extremely relaxing, and also fun for creating minimalist soundscapes to improvise over.

Excellent app though I would echo the requests for the app to continue working in the background, or when the screen is off. Also, what's happened to the continuous drone sound that was a feature of the original?

I absolutely love this app but is it possible that it could be made to continue if the screen closes, like with a podcast or music app? Sometimes I like to be mobile but still use the app on my phone.
Great app for creating calming music with little to no effort. My only request is that the music should continue to play with the app in background or screen off, even if just with automatic mode.
Super nice app, writing great. Will get 5 starts when it has background play üòä I want to listen with the screen off and phone in pocket. OnePlus 6, Android 10. Many thanks.
Awesomeness
Good app. Please make compatible with Pixel 3.
üôè
My all time favorite app.

The original "Bloom" app for iOS was ALMOST enough to make me want an iphone. This is not just endlessly enthralling. It's a genuine creative experience rooted in some pretty sophisticated musical knowledge. I SIMPLY LOVE LOVE LOVE IT and I was SOOOO excited to see it is available in an update form for Android.... UNTIL I saw that it is NOT COMPATIBLE with my Pixel phone.... :( SOOOOO BUMMED OUT! However, I have an older Android tablet that it DOES work on and it is every bit as fantastic as the original Bloom iOS app. Please don't hesitate to pay for and use this app. My kids LOVE it too. But PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE fix the compatibility issue with the Pixel so I can enjoy it everywhere I go. PLEASE!

As others have said, this is an extremely relaxing, enjoyable app. It's not a game, so if you want something that does best with lots of activity, this isn't for you. If you want something to put you into sort of a "zen" mode, look no further. My one request - and the thing keeping me from using this a *lot* more - would be to enable background play. I know the art is great and relaxing, but sometimes I want to listen while reading. Many people have asked for this - I really hope it gets added.
Awesome ambient soundscape generation.
Cool like Headcandy.
Awesome
Amazing app, allowing you to so simply compose something very listenable to. Maybe the perfect app.

Not a musical instrument but rather to be seen as a sophisticated digital wind-chime creating ethereal abstract sound-paintings. For those who like ambient minimal music & art, wind-chimes, Eno, Satie, Cage & Malevich. For relaxation & contemplation & quiet work. A culmination of Eno's work, who has always aimed to create a fusion of music & painting. It raises questions about the nature of music & authorship. Excellent quality of sound & visuals. Given the great artistic merit & work, the price is very good. By tapping the canvas one adds audio-visual elements but has no control over their nature & behavior. A ''ghost Eno'' algo takes over, loops them & carries out various permutations, in stereo. One cannot remove elements, but older ones recede when adding new ones. If satisfied with a painting, one can sit back and it continues by itself indefinitely, gradually slowing. Due to inherent randomness one cannot exactly recreate earlier sessions, but the basic elements & mood of a world are constant.  Should be further developed, e.g. with speed control. 3D visuals?  Should be able to run in the background: A tablet or phone is not a large TV screen & battery power is a concern.
groovy

Studio musician here. This is a fantastically-elegant (simple) user interface to some really cool ambient sounds arranged into "worlds" you can manipulate with fingers to create some nice ambient music. There are currently 10 different worlds. I would like more features. I would suggest these additions to developers 1. Users can import up to 8 sound files onto a blank world. 2. User can save work onto lossless file format and export. 3. User able to "stack" worlds to create multi-tracks.

Love it! But pls could you developers make this run also with screen off and other apps running? This way its impossible to use the app as an ambient/background music generator - which I supposed it's intended for
lovely interactive app, but I just want music to play.
Beautiful concept that has been flawlessly developed.
very chill way cool

its okay however you can't use it while doing anything else on you phone. looking at the artwork gets boring fast but the music is great. I'd love to be able to continue listening to the music while doing other things with the screen. ie work, read...

What a fantastic app - like having ten, or even a hundred, or a thousand, Brian Eno albums for less than ten pounds. I like the fact you can't record - it gives the sounds/music an ephemeral quality that is in keeping with their meditative nature. The images are rather beautiful as well, especially the gorgeous Edo. A long-time coming on Android but well worth the weight.
I love it and will update to 5 stars when it plays in the background.
Enjoying it tremendously. So grateful it's finally available for Android!
just brilliant, wish you could save ypur sessions
Fantastic, thank you Mr Eno XX

Its a shame that this app just doesnt work in the background . You cant record your ambient music inside this app which is also misunderstanding. After all im little dissapointed but it's still a decent app ,but for what purpose?
no bluetooth audio connectivity? amazing app

Android user. The app is fantastic in many ways but one , which really must be solved in updates. If you navigate away from the screen it stops. if you turn off your screen it stops. I use the auto play feature during work and I want the screen to go blank. I use it when going to bed and I want the sound to continue and really want the screen blank. I want to be able to navigate away from it to check email and have the music continue. let it work in this way just like any music app.
Wonderful, wonderful...... !!! I want more apps like this one.
Finally for Android! Immersive, compelling, and yet totally unobtrusive. Just beautiful.

Absolutely brilliant! Use it every day. Night time I put it for ten - twenty minutes to send me to sleep. Would have liked to see an option to use it as alarm chime as well. Also, is it possible to make the app still play the sound when the focus is shifted from the app, e.g. reading something on Kindle app?

It's neat.  Makes interesting ambient sounds that are pleasant. It's $5, so you're paying for Eno's name on it. Even then still over priced. It works on my OLD (2012) samsung tablet and OLD (2014) GS5, but not my brand new pixel 3? Meh.
It desperately needs a record option please !!!
Finally available for android, and oh so wonderful. Would love a sleep timer longer than 60 minutes, at least a couple of hours. Beautiful app!
Eno is a genius.

Just Heard About It When Brian Eno Was Interviewed On Click, BBC World Service. Sophos Security Says It Is security risk. Brian warned new android version was hard to create and it does not work on old tablet but it is beautiful and His advice how to use it is simple and good.
I really like this. Great visualisations that I can throw to the Chromecast. Been waiting 10 years for this to come to Android, and I'm not disappointed. Great work.

Not only a fine app, but a serious contender for Best Thing Ever. Is it an instrument or a time-waster? An intuitive-but-opaque compositional tool or a toy? A generator of seemingly random noises or a much-needed method of reclaiming one's personal sonic space from an endless daily cavalcade of sales pitches? Yes. Yes it is. Depends on what you want to do with it, doesn't it?
It's not for everyone. Check out Eno ambient works prior to buying.
Been waiting a long time for this app to hit Android. Very well executed. My only request would be for a free play mode where the notes don't repeat.

Have a musical idea? This app won't help. It's an algorithmic composer where you tap the screen and it plays notes and makes lava lamp-like images. These all repeat and are warped on every repeat. The tempo is slow and unadjustable and any idea you might have will be warped unrecognizeably within a few repeats. This is the kind of app you play with for 10 minutes and never touch again. Unfortunate.
replyContent: Hello Rich, sorry if the app isn't what you were expecting, but we've not marketed Bloom: 10 Worlds as a composition tool or an instrument. It's intended to create an immersive and engaging ambient experience. I'd dispute your final claim though ; we regularly hear from people who are still using the original Bloom ten years on!

content: Absolutely stunning tool to create ambient soundscapes. The sound quality is very good. Thank you for making a port for Android.

I have always wanted to grow up and be BrianEno...however since there already is one this is the next best thing. He has given us this tool which provides the ability to create unlimited atmospheres and simply delicious sonic wallpapers...this is " Music for Airports" on steroids...and the best part is YOU are the engineer. This will be the best Christmas present I've given myself in many years. Thank you Mr. Eno and friends!
Wow!
Create ambient soundscapes you can carry in your pocket. Beautiful.
Been waiting 10 years for a version to finally be available on Android. A must have if you're a fan of Eno's (or anyone else's for that matter) ambient works.
